intro: Erythrostemon mexicanus, commonly known as Mexican flameflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The showy flowers attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees, making it a valuable plant in ecological and ornamental settings.
